subject: Add a IPMI blob handler for SMBIOS tables
commitMessage:
Add a IPMI blob handler for SMBIOS tables

smbios-mdr has dependencies on intel-ipmi-oem which makes BIOS sending
SMBIOS tables to BMC through VGA shared memory. For platforms without
intel-ipmi-oem, implement a IPMI blob hanler so that BIOS can send
SMBIOS tables through IPMI blob interfaces.

Test:
Unit tests for the IPMI blob handler.
Manual test that transfers SMBIOS tables to BMC through IPMI blob
interfaces on a platform host.

Signed-off-by: Jie Yang <jjy@google.com>
Change-Id: I9bc1ae7e9bfaa793e47e38fa19049f0f69355189

Is there a design doc for smbios-mdr that we can add this to?

It's conceptually identical to Intel's implementation, but just adds phosphor-ipmi-blobs as a new option for transferring the tables as opposed to just Intel OEM commands.

Patch Set 10:

(9 comments)

PTAL

Notes about the new path:
  * deleted all maps, as the handler only allows opening one session with a hardcoded blobId;
  * rewrite the commit() logic. If a session stat is committed / committing, commit() will directly 
    return the stat without calling commit() again; if a session stat is commit_error, which is 
    probably due to the failure of writing sys file or syncing the data with smbios-mdr service, try
    to re-commit the data
  * delete the commit unit test for this moment, as creating file on openBMC CI will always fail. But  
    this handler has been tested on physical machines.

1. Whether test it on Intel platform? and see what's the impact?
2. Please share detail test method here.

> 1. Whether test it on Intel platform? and see what's the impact?
> 2. Please share detail test method here.

1. Yes. It is tested on Intel platform in google data center. It will create a dedicated IPMI blob handler for SMBIOS tables shown as a library artifact on BMC, as google BMC will not contain all the commands of [intel-ipmi-oem](https://github.com/openbmc/intel-ipmi-oem), especially the intel OEM MDR commands. Thus, we use [IPMI blob interface](https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-ipmi-blobs) to update SMBIOS tables.

2. Test requires to implement IPMI blob commands on BIOS/UEFI side. [link to the BIOS change](https://github.com/u-root/u-root/pull/1944). When booting, BIOS will issue IPMI commands to write and commit the blob. In the commit operation, smbios-mdr AgentSynchronizeData method will be called, such that SMBIOS tables can get updated.

Typically, Intel BMC will not not need this library. Easy to set this off in compiling. But for non-Intel BMC that wanna absorb SMBIOS tables in BIOS time and parse the SMBIOS tables use smbios-mdr, it would be handy.
Intel platforms can leave this disabled and continue using their OEM commands, so it shouldn't have an effect there.

This might make more sense inside of the SmbiosBlobHandler class, since it's only used there. That would also mean you don't need to pass in the maxBufferSize

do we support reading back the SMBIOS tables from the BMC on the host?
No. Reading is disabled.
Probably not important for SMBIOS tables since they don't contain sensitive data

since the session limit is 1, you don't really need to have a map of open sessions. you can just keep the single open session ID and buffer here directly
delete the session->blob and blobId->session maps, as this handler will only one session and one unique hardcoded blob ID. Use a blob pointer as a class member instead.

I suggest against using this parameter in the unit test since it wouldn't catch an unexpected change to maxSessions()

You can actually just remove this test since the next one is identical
